Package animation

Provides controllers that can animate a scene by changing characteristics of the scene objects through a channelized interface. Often spatial characteristics, like the position or orientation of an object are manipulated to move an object, but it is also possible to change the appearance of objects by adapting their colors or materials, or by changing the lighting. One special case is the camera movement (taken care by CameraController). Each controller is only responsible for a small set of characteristics (in most cases it is only one attribute that is controlled), which is adapted according to certain logic, either time-dependent or in accordance with interactive user commands. A controller can change attribute via a the channel interface.
Since:
1.0
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstController
    Base class for animation controllers.
    CameraController
    Controller for interactive camera positioning and orientation.
    FollowerCameraController
    The camera shall move along a certain path in the 3D scene.
    FunctionR1R1Controller
    Manipulates a (one-dimensional) float channel according to a specified time-parameterized function (commonly an interpolation function).
    FunctionR1Vec3Controller  
    FunctionR1Vec4Controller  
    InteractiveJointController
    Manipulates a Vec3 channel (e.g. translation channel) according to a specified 3D function, which is modeling a path in 3D space.
    JointController
    Manipulates a Vec3 channel (e.g. translation channel) according to a specified 3D function, which is modeling a path in 3D space.
    PathController Deprecated.
    SliderController  
    TimeSliderController  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AbstController.RepeatType
    animation repeat type: RT_CLAMP- runs animation only once within specified time frame RT_CYCLE - runs animation repeatedly, always starting from the beginning RT_OSCILLATE- runs animation repeatedly forward and backward
